etymology.description: 艸(艸) (cǎo, "grass") + phonetic: abbreviated 聰(聰) (cōng) = plant-like growth characteristic -> fungi, mushroom
etymology.interpretation: The character 茸(róng) indicates a kind of plant or growth with the 艸(艸) (cǎo, "grass") indicating its nature as a plant-related entity. The phonetic 聰(聰) (cōng) suggests the pronunciation, though it is abbreviated in this character.

examples.chinese: 这种茸在雨后更为鲜美(這種茸在雨後更為鮮美)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè zhǒng róng zài yǔ hòu gèng wéi xiān měi.
examples.english: This mushroom is even more delicious after the rain.

examples.chinese: 春天来临时(春天來臨時)，边林的茸悄然绽放(邊林的茸悄然綻放)。
examples.pinyin: Chūn tiān lái lín shí, biān lín de róng qiāo rán zhàn fàng.
examples.english: When spring arrives, the mushrooms at the edge of the forest bloom quietly.

examples.chinese: 他采集茸样品(他採集茸樣品)，送往实验室检测(送往實驗室檢測)。
examples.pinyin: Tā cǎi jí róng yàng pǐn, sòng wǎng shí yàn shì jiǎn cè.
examples.english: He collected samples of the mushroom and sent them to the laboratory for testing.
